alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 05 at 4:56AM EDT until September 05 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Georgia, including the following counties, Chattooga, Floyd and Walker. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 452 AM EDT, even though water levels have receded, emergency management continues to report ongoing flooding across the warned area. Between 6 and 12 inches of rain fell on Sunday. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rome, Summerville, Trion, Shannon, Lyerly, Menlo, James H. Floyd State Park, Tidings, Berryton, Holland, Armuchee, Chattoogaville, Coosa, Subligna and Cloudland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
